theme.title: Compound time. Three quarter notes
theme.para: In this lesson a new rhythmic pattern is introduced, as the result of tying the notes, in pairs, of two triplets. Note that in can also be written using a quarter note:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (time 6 8)(n * e g+)(n * e)(n * e l g-)(n * e g+)(n * e)(n * e g-)(barline) (n * q)(n * e l)(n * e)(n * q)(barline) (n * q)(n * e l)(n * e g+)(n * e)(n * e g-)(barline end) )))

part.title: Listen and take notice of the differences
part.para: Note the difference between the first and the second measure, and between the third and the fourth ones. Note how measures 2 and 4 are similar to measures 1 and 3 and are formed by tying the triplets.

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (clef G)(key C)(time 6 8)(n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g-)(n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e l g-)(n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g-)(barline) (n a4 q)(n a4 e)(n a4 e)(n a4 q)(barline) (n a4 q)(n a4 e l)(n a4 e)(n a4 q)(barline end) )))

part.title: Exercises
part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear and practise the introduced rhythmic patterns.
Exercise 2 - Read scores containing the rhythms studied in this lesson.
